Widgets (Cube/Cylinder/Sphere/Autoclave cage/plastic bottle/metal can)

Widgets work slightly differently then the other objects in the Qlabs workspaces. Widgets can’t be modified once created. They also can’t be deleted individually.

Description

Library

class library_qlabs_widget.QLabsWidget[source]

This class is for the spawning of widgets. Widgets are special actors that cannot be addressed after they have been spawned so they do not support parenting. They are highly efficient so it is possible to spawn thousands of widgets while maintaining performance.

Constants

QLabsWidget.CUBE = 0
QLabsWidget.CYLINDER = 1
QLabsWidget.SPHERE = 2
QLabsWidget.AUTOCLAVE_CAGE = 3
QLabsWidget.PLASTIC_BOTTLE = 4
QLabsWidget.METAL_CAN = 5

Methods

QLabsWidget.spawn(qlabs, widgetType, location, rotation, scale, color, measuredMass=0, IDTag=0, properties='', waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a widget in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using radians.

Parameters

  • qlabs (QuanserInteractiveLabs object) – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • widgetType (uint32) – See QLabsWidget class

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in radians.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • color (float array[3]) – Red, Green, Blue components of the RGB color on a 0.0 to 1.0 scale.

  • measuredMass (float) – A float value for use with mass sensor instrumented actors. This does not alter the dynamic properties.

  • IDTag (uint8) – An integer value for use with IDTag sensor instrumented actors.

  • properties (string) – A string for use with properties sensor instrumented actors. This can contain any string that is available for use to parse out user-customized parameters.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred.

Returns

If waitForConfirmation = False then returns True if spawn was successful, False otherwise. If waitForConfirmation = True, returns a container detailed response information if successful, otherwise False.

Return type

boolean or CommModularContainer object

QLabsWidget.spawn_degrees(qlabs, widgetType, location, rotation, scale, color, measuredMass=0, IDTag=0, properties='', waitForConfirmation=True)[source]

Spawns a widget in an instance of QLabs at a specific location and rotation using degrees.

Parameters

  • qlabs – A QuanserInteractiveLabs object.

  • widgetType (uint32) – See QLabsWidget class

  • location (float array[3]) – An array of floats for x, y and z coordinates.

  • rotation (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the roll, pitch, and yaw in degrees.

  • scale (float array[3]) – An array of floats for the scale in the x, y, and z directions.

  • color (float array[3]) – Red, Green, Blue components of the RGB color on a 0.0 to 1.0 scale.

  • measuredMass (float) – A float value for use with mass sensor instrumented actors. This does not alter the dynamic properties.

  • IDTag (uint8) – An integer value for use with IDTag sensor instrumented actors.

  • properties (string) – A string for use with properties sensor instrumented actors. This can contain any string that is available for use to parse out user-customized parameters.

  • waitForConfirmation (boolean) – (Optional) Make this operation blocking until confirmation of the spawn has occurred.

Returns

If waitForConfirmation = False then returns True if spawn was successful, False otherwise. If waitForConfirmation = True, returns a container detailed response information if successful, otherwise False.

Return type

boolean or CommModularContainer object
